alert.note: Alert for Dade; Walker (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 9:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Walker and northeastern Dade Counties through 945 PM EDT... At 930 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from Jasper to near Hooker to near Cooper Heights, and moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lookout Mountain, Fairview, Chattanooga Valley, Morganville, Hooker, Cooper Heights, Wildwood, Cole City and Lakeview. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
